page.title: 13Thakeham Tiles
page.content: { Thakeham Tiles was founded in 1933 by a Mr King to make roof tiles. Re-opening after the war the site covered an area of eleven acres although only five are used for manufacturing purposes. Roof tiles are no longer made; paving slabs, building blocks and decorative wall blocks being produced instead. Approximately 2500 plain and decorated paving slabs and 10700 cavity and solid building blocks are made each day, most of them by hand. Sixty people are employed, thirty eight of whom actually make the slabs and blocks. The working day is 8 hours long, beginning at 7.30. The product is sold to retail outlets all over the south east of England.
